</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.64</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Arguments in MP</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns [[Array]] of [[Number]]s, where numbers are IDs of all user actions added to given entity with [[addAction]] command. </value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[actionIDs]] entity </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> entity: [[Object]] - entity with added user actions </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - Array with user action IDs </value></part><part><name>Return Value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_actions = [[actionIDs]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>  [[actionParams]], [[addAction]], [[setUserActionText]], [[inGameUISetEventHandler]], [[showHUD]], [[inputAction]], [[removeAction]], [[removeAllActions]], [[action]]</value></part><part><name>See Also</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR </name>=<value>

<dt class="note">[[User:KC Grimes|KC Grimes]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The argument for this command can be global (ie, not local to the executing machine), however the returned array will only contain action IDs for locally executed [[addAction]].</dd>
